newsitem.title: USA: WARNER MUSIC IN DEAL WITH DAVID FOSTER - WSJ.
newsitem.headline: WARNER MUSIC IN DEAL WITH DAVID FOSTER - WSJ.

text.p: Time Warner Inc's Warner Music Group is expected to announce Thursday that it signed a wide-ranging employment deal with big-name music producer David Foster, the Wall Street Journal reported.
Foster, 47, was formerly vice president at Warner's Atlantic Records and ran his own label -- 143 Records -- under the Atlantic umbrella, the paper said.
He has produced albums for Celine Dion, Whitney Houston and other stars.

The agreement with Warner Music gives Foster a broad role in working with senior label management at the heads of Warner Music's three music labels, Elektra, Atlantic and Warner Bros Records to sign new talent, the paper said.
The paper said Foster was also wooed by Seagram's Universal Music Group.
